meanings.definition: The property of a material to change its electrical resistance in response to an applied magnetic field.
meanings.sent1: The magnetoresistance of the metal wire increased when a magnet was brought close.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study magnetoresistance to understand how materials behave in magnetic fields.
meanings.sent3: The magnetoresistance of the circuit was so high that even the magnetic field couldn't get through!
meanings.sent4: Her stubbornness was like magnetoresistance, unyielding to any external influence.
meanings.sent5: The concept of magnetoresistance can be compared to a door that only opens when a specific magnetic key is used.
